channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Human vomit at Laburnum Court, 2nd December
item.description:
There is human vomit in the building at Laburnum Court. Please clean this ASAP.
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocking corner of road., 2nd December
item.description:
Cars parking right on the corner over double yellows. Most often this is a VW EV with a blue badge but they leave it there all day long and not that for the 3 hours they are legally allowed to. They block large vehicles from making the turning. It's inconsiderate a d foolish parking.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swiftsden Way, Downham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: FX70 OEP crashed vehicle, 2nd December
item.description:
There is a badly crashed vehicle at this location. Black mercedes number plate FX70 OEP. Yes it is taxed but it is a hazard to other road users and pedestrians in its current condition. Like many cars here, it has been left by the someone who works at the Volkswagen dealership, group 1, previously known as beadles. They cause chaos with their parking whilst residents get a ticket.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Swiftsden Way, Downham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Close to 2 or 4 Cavendish Road pavement, 2nd December
item.description:
Someone threw out some old chairs and other furniture /see on pictures/ we passed by it with my children this morning. It's dangerous for small children. I clean up lots of littering on this road but this is too much to handle. I'm concerned about my little ones safety.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Cavendish Road, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Black bollard in grass area knocked over on pavement & in road, 2nd December
item.description:
I reported this issue back in 2023 (reference number - 4830717) where a builder knock this and it was leaning obstructing me getting onto and off my drive. This was fixed the same day, however, this fell down again a few days after. Today a neighbour on the road done a 3 point turn outside my house and when manoeuvred forward the neighbour drove into the pole knocking it over on the grass area, of which part of it is in the road. Please can this either be removed as it causes constant issues with stability or fixed properly. This is the pole outside in between number 15 & 17 Oaklands Avenue, DA15 8NF. Thank you Natalie
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 17, Oaklands Avenue, Blackfen, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This car has been outside my Mum’s property for over 6 weeks, 2nd December
item.description:

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tyrrell Avenue, Blackfen, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Van abandoned in Ambleside Road for nearly 4 months, 2nd December
item.description:
As I’ve explained before This has been reported about 6 time yet you keep responding ‘no further action’ WHY???? It’s illegal as it’s on a public road with no MOT. The police say you need to deal with it. Please provide contact details for this to be taken further. Or at least provide help do that we’re not fobbed off again. Just how long does it have to be there before you decide to take action?? I think the residents in Ambleside Road have been patient enough.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 34, Ambleside Road, Barnehurst, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Glass shards, 2nd December
item.description:
My apologies for this being in wrong category, this is not really a bin but litter never the less. Please direct me right way for correct category for the next time. Thank you Just need this swept up please, I’m taking my 4years old to school on this road and it’s sharp enough to stick to your shoes, bit concerned if anyone trips over in this. Thank you

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Myrtledene Road, Plumstead
